definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: Over the years Lottie had urged Bess to prepare for her old age.
sentences.chinese: 年年岁岁珞蒂总劝碧丝要为年老之后做点准备。

sentences.english: The wall-to-wall carpet hasn’t been updated in years.
sentences.chinese: 屋里的地毯已经有不少年岁了。
适宜年岁大的抗衰老面霜。

sentences.english: No matter who, as long as the elderly, she says it is.
sentences.chinese: 不管谁，只要年岁大，她都称其为师。

sentences.english: In good years they have surplus crops to sell.
sentences.chinese: 在好年岁时，他们还能有多余的作物可以拿来卖钱。
人们说那座教堂年岁久远。

sentences.english: Know my husband when we are of marriageable age.
sentences.chinese: 相识我老公时我们都已经是婚龄年岁了。

sentences.english: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
sentences.chinese: 你借着我，日子必增多，年岁也必加添。

sentences.english: And borne the conflict of dream-shattering years.
sentences.chinese: 并承受过让你梦想破没的年岁。

sentences.english: O memory, hope, and love of finished years.
sentences.chinese: 我的回忆，希望与爱，在那些蹉跎的年岁。

sentences.english: The older person is very prestige, be respected.
sentences.chinese: 上了年岁的人很有声威，遭到尊崇。

sentences.english: With age, we lose muscle mass, and our connective tissues lose some of their elasticity.
sentences.chinese: 随着年岁的增大，你的肌肉会萎缩，韧带会失去弹性。

sentences.english: And I think those years often were very boring years.
sentences.chinese: 我想，这些年岁往往非常乏味。

sentences.english: Jefferson is, and at 24, should remain so for the next decade, The Franchise.
sentences.chinese: 年仅24年岁的杰弗森将会在未来的十年里统治赛场。

sentences.english: Pre-owned cars that are only a few years old with low mileage are the best bargains.
sentences.chinese: 那些年岁尚可，行程低的旧车才是最好的选择。

sentences.english: Noboday grows old merely by a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals.
sentences.chinese: 年岁有加，并非垂老，理想丢弃，方随暮年。

definition: to be in the prime of life
to not be wiser despite being older/to be older than (you) by (humble)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people
lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
